arm_group.description: Obese patients selected for laparoscopic sleeve gastrectomy with preoperative GER at 24 H pH-monitoring (Group A)
Obese patients selected for laparoscopic sleeve gastrectomy without preoperative GER at 24 H pH-monitoring (Group B)

brief_summary.textblock:
Symptomatic Gastroesophageal Reflux (GER) is considered by many a contraindication to
      laparoscopic sleeve gastrectomy (LSG). However, of the few studies that have investigated
      the relationship between LSG and GER the majority reported only changes in symptoms and
      manometric data, while assessment of GER using 24-hour pH monitoring is lacking.

      The aim of this study is to evaluate the effect of LSG on GER in morbidly obese patients.

clinical_study.brief_title: Laparoscopic Sleeve Gastrectomy and Gastroesophageal Acid Reflux

detailed_description.textblock:
Consecutive morbidly obese patients selected for LSG are included in a prospective clinical
      study. Gastroesophageal function is evaluated using a clinical validated questionnaire,
      upper endoscopy, esophageal manometry and 24-h pH monitoring before and 24 months after LSG.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  history of obesity exceeding 5 years

          -  documented previous weight loss attempts,

          -  body mass index (BMI)) of 40-50 kg/m2

          -  age of 18-60 years.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  contraindications to pneumoperitoneum

          -  large esophageal hiatal hernia

          -  pregnancy,

          -  drug or alcohol abuse,

          -  psychological disorders (e.g., bulimia, depression)

          -  hormonal or genetic obesity-related disease,

          -  previous gastric surgery

study_pop.textblock: Consecutive morbidly obese patients selected for LSG

clinical_study.official_title: Physiopathologic Evaluation of Esophageal Function After Laparoscopic Sleeve Gastrectomy

primary_outcome.description: Use of the composite score that evaluates GER at 24-h pH monitoring before and 24 months after LSG. It includes numbers of reflux episodes, upright time in reflux, recumbent time in reflux, total time in reflux, reflux episodes over 5 minutes, longest reflux episodes
primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in DeMeester's score

secondary_outcome.description: Esophageal manometry evaluates quality and amplitude of esophageal peristalsis

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in grade of esophagitis
